group_1.textRight: …So what strategy are you two working@on now?

group_1.textLeft: We're spreading a suspicious prophecy.

group_1.textRight: I would've phrased that a little differently…
Could you explain more?
…I see.@You wish to use the temple of the gods…
…to spread a prophecy that the mountain@will erupt in flame.

group_1.textLeft: Yes…@First of all, we have contacted the Cult of Isis.

group_1.narration: "In Pompeii, many gods such as@Jupiter and Apollo were worshiped@alongside Venus, its patron deity."
"Isis was an Egyptian goddess, but@she was also worshiped in Roman territory.@She was particularly popular among@traders and women."

group_1.textLeft: Yes…and the Cult of Isis has influence over@elections as well.
If we can get its high-ranking members@to believe in the prophecy,
I believe it will bolster the number of@"evacuationists," to borrow Nemu's term…!

group_1.textRight: If more people perceive the rise in earthquakes@as a harbinger of eruption,
I believe it will encourage consideration of@advanced evacuation or migration.

group_1.textLeft: If all goes well, we'd like to spread the@prophecy to other cults as well.
If the prophecy can spread through other@towns via religious orders,
the people of Pompeii, as well as other areas,
won't be left shedding tears of misery.
…In fact, we've already started work on the@councils of other towns.

group_1.textRight: Indeed, Pompeii is not the only town that will@face devastation…
Places like Herculaneum and Stabiae will be@affected as well.

group_1.textLeft: I knew it…@What about Neapolis?

group_1.textRight: It appears to have escaped major destruction@due to the movement of the wind.

group_1.textLeft: And Nuceria?@Or Misenum on the opposite shore?

group_1.textRight: They are safe as well, as far as I know…

group_1.textLeft: …You kinda gave her a lot of details about@the future.

group_1.textRight: Right, while we should be cautious about@interfering with history.
But since our presence has already triggered@a paradox,
I would like to provide information on History B,@which we are aiming for.
Given that there were relatively few casualties@outside of Pompeii,
if Amaryllis saves the other towns as well,@it will not be in conflict with our history.
Obviously, a line must be drawn somewhere…@We can't tell her about everything.

group_1.textLeft: …I see, so regarding the other towns,
based on the information Nemu gave us,
we must proceed with our plans carefully…

group_1.textRight: This suddenly became way bigger than@I expected.

group_1.textLeft: But we have to do it!@I want everyone to be saved.

group_1.textRight: You said you'd already contacted the Cult@of Isis, correct?

group_1.textLeft: Yes…thanks to my metamorphosis,
I disguised myself as someone sent by divine@command to warn them of future disaster…
…You say you cannot reveal the name of@the god you serve?

group_1.textRight: Yes…unfortunately.
But even so.
The god is willing to save the lives of everyone@regardless of worship.

group_1.textLeft: If you truly know the future as you claim…
I would like to see proof.

group_1.textRight: Hm, hm, so what kind of proof?

group_1.textLeft: The results of the chariot race to be held@in two days!
The up-and-coming Hilarus the Left-Handed@will achieve his first victory!
[chara:105301:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]And with that, his winning streak will begin!

group_1.textRight: Are you a fan of his?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
After Ludus, chariot races are my other@favorite pastime.

group_1.textRight: You've got a fun life★

group_1.textLeft: I was blessed with a second life thanks to@Master Cubius…

group_1.textRight: I see… I totally get you.
We gotta enjoy life as much as we can@whenever we catch a break.
If we get the result of the race right,@we'll get the Cult's cooperation?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, that's what we were talking about.
Perhaps the impersonation magic was effective@and got them to believe us without trouble.
So we'll be there in two days to support@the race.
And we have an important purpose there@besides!

group_1.textRight: Important purpose…?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, the day after tomorrow is also Lady@Cornelia's birthday.
She and Lord Marius will be watching the race@together.

group_1.textRight: A birthday date?!@That's another chance to trigger a flag!
Won't it be both Cornelia and Junia's birthday?

group_1.textLeft: Junia will be celebrating with her adopted@father at their villa during that time!

group_1.textRight: You'll be joining me to watch the race, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I've made arrangements behind the scenes@to ensure that happens…
…And on that note, I must take my leave!
I'm delivering a forged letter to a visitor@from another town.

group_1.textRight: I'll go with you if you don't mind.

group_1.textLeft: I'll be fine…@That's the end of my plans for today.

group_1.textRight: Don't you think us cuties should join you?
That way, if things go down like they did at@the banquet, we'll have your back!

group_1.textLeft: Ah…thank you very much!

group_1.textRight: You said it was a forged letter…?@What for?

group_1.textLeft: It's to bribe some persons of influence@in Herculaneum.

group_1.textRight: That's a dirty move!
…You really get up to a lot of stuff, huh?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. When Lady Junia's adopted father insists@on the local winemaking industry,
I work rumors to convey that it will be@a dead-end venture…
I also have business associates of Cornelia's@father speak with him,
trying to convince him to move his operations@to another port.

group_1.textRight: …While we're here,
why don't I take you all on a tour of Mercurius@Avenue and the Triumphal Arch?

group_1.textLeft: That's right, it's just a short walk from here!
What's up, Nemurin?

group_1.textRight: The book is in an incredible state of instability.
Could the cause of the time paradox be right@nearby…?

group_1.textLeft: [se:7201_detect_magic][chara:102801:effect_ef_adv_01]*Gasp*

group_1.textRight: I knew it…!
We seem to be the ones in charge of battles@now…
